intro: Mariscus angularis, commonly known as the angular mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a distinctive angular shape. Mariscus angularis is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
